intro: Stenostomum guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan stenostomum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Stenostomum guianensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
